author: DHANANJAY MAHAPATRA
description: The Supreme Court has declined to direct the Election Commission to accept Aadhaar as sole proof of citizenship for Bihar voter list enrollment, emphasizing its legal limitations. Justices Surya Kant and Joymalya Bagchi reiterated that Aadhaar remains an identity document, not a citizenship proof, aligning with the Aadhaar Act and the Puttaswamy judgment.
title: Aadhaar can't be standalone proof of citizenship, says SC

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: The hockey world mourns the loss of Johnny Gaudreau, fondly called 'Johnny Hockey'. His journey began with Skittles on the ice, thanks to his father. Gaudreau's talent shone at Boston College and in the NHL. He played for the Calgary Flames and Columbus Blue Jackets. His career highlights include All-Star appearances.
title: Legacy of Gaudreau: Modest start with candy rewards; fans mourn loss

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: OpenAI has initiated a policy to monitor ChatGPT conversations, flagging potential threats of violence and reporting users to law enforcement when deemed necessary by human reviewers. This decision follows a tragic incident where a user's paranoid delusions were allegedly fueled by the chatbot, leading to a murder-suicide.
title: Policy shake-up: OpenAI to flag violent chats; law enforcement may be alerted

author: SACHIN PARASHAR
description: Despite US pressure, India and Russia reaffirmed their strong ties at the SCO summit, with PM Modi and President Putin emphasizing their nations' enduring friendship and cooperation. Modi highlighted the importance of their partnership for global stability, while Putin noted the positive momentum in trade and economic relations.
title: Riding out American storm: Modi joins Putin in his limo; seeks early end to Ukraine conflict

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Pranav Venkatesh triumphed in the Superstars section of the Fujairah Global Chess 2025, held in UAE. He secured victory with an aggressive final-round win, finishing with 7.0/9 points. Prior to this, the 2025 World Junior Champion earned a spot in the FIDE Grand Swiss by winning the "Asian Wildcard Match"Z against GM Kazybek Nogerbek.
title: 18-year-old Pranav V strikes again! 2025 World Jr Champion clinches Fujairah title

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Infosys has adjusted its evening bus schedule from its Electronic City facility in Bengaluru, effective September 1, to address employee concerns about lengthy commutes impacting productivity and client interactions with US counterparts.
title: Bengaluru traffic: Infosys reschedules bus service; commute clashed with US calls

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Amid strengthening ties between India and Russia, Moscow is exploring potential investments to manufacture its Sukhoi Su-57 fifth-generation fighter jets in India. This development occurs as India seeks advanced air defense systems from Russia and navigates trade tensions with the United States, who is also offering its F-35 fighter jets.
title: India-Russia defence ties: Su-57 fighter jets to be made in India?

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Kieron Pollard, at 38, showcased his explosive batting prowess in the Caribbean Premier League, reminding everyone of his destructive capabilities. After a slow start, he unleashed a brutal assault, smashing seven sixes in eight balls against St Kitts and Nevis Patriots.
title: Pure carnage! 7 sixes in 8 balls: Kieron Pollard's astonishing assault on bowlers

author: TIMESOFINDIA.COM
description: The Supreme Court has greenlit the nationwide rollout of E20 petrol by 2025, dismissing concerns about compatibility with older vehicles. The court sided with the government's argument that E20 supports sugarcane farmers, reduces emissions, and decreases reliance on fossil fuels. While newer vehicles are E20-ready, older models might experience reduced fuel efficiency and potential wear.
title: SC dismisses plea against E20 petrol policy: What it means - and other important FAQs

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: India stormed into the Asia Cup Super 4s with a dominant 15-0 victory over Kazakhstan, marking their third consecutive win. Abhishek's four goals led the charge, supported by hat-tricks from Sukhjeet Singh and Jugraj Singh. China also advanced from Pool A, while Malaysia and Korea progressed from Pool B.
title: Asia Cup: Goals galore in Bihar! India humiliate Kazakhstan 15-0

author: CHIDANAND RAJGHATTA
description: Donald Trump called trade with India a disaster. Analysts criticized his approach, saying it pushes India towards China and Russia. Trump complained about trade imbalance and India buying oil from Russia. US media reported on warm interactions between Narendra Modi, Xi Jinping, and Vladimir Putin. Despite this, the US State Department says the US-India partnership remains important.
title: One-sided picture: Trade with India a 'one-sided' disaster, says Trump

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Donald Trump has criticized India for its continued oil and arms purchases from Russia, leading to a 25% tariff imposed by the US. Despite this, both the US and EU continue significant trade with Russia, importing billions worth of goods.
title: Reality check for Trump! Why blame India? US, EU trade with Russia runs in billions

author: PALLAVI
description: Rahul Gandhi's 'Voter Adhikar Yatra' in Bihar, a 16-day campaign across 25 districts, aimed to protect voters' rights. Gandhi alleged that the BJP and Election Commission disenfranchised 65 lakh voters. The yatra, joined by INDIA bloc leaders, showcased opposition unity. It concluded in Patna, framing the campaign as a fight for electoral justice.
title: Vote 'chori', makhana & 'gamcha': Decoding 16 days of Rahul's Bihar yatra - key points

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Rohit Sharma, India's ODI captain, was recently filmed in a light-hearted video with the team physiotherapist after undergoing a fitness test in Bengaluru alongside Jasprit Bumrah and Shubman Gill. Having retired from Test cricket, Rohit is set to play for India A against Australia A in Kanpur as preparation for the upcoming ODI tour of Australia in October.
title: Hitman! Rohit Sharma's chat with physio goes viral: 'Ajao chhod deta hu tumko':

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: At a Shanghai Cooperation Organization summit, leaders from India, China, and Russia displayed a united front, potentially undermining Washington's influence. This convergence, highlighted by warm interactions and strategic agreements, signals a shift in global power dynamics. Putin's strategic positioning aims to strengthen ties with both Beijing and New Delhi, challenging the US's Cold War strategy.
title: SCO meet: How Modi, Putin, Xi flipped Trump's tariff gambit - 'reverse Nixon'?

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Starting September 2, 2025, the US State Department will require in-person interviews for nearly all non-immigrant visa applicants, ending many age-based exemptions and renewal waivers. This change affects students, professionals, and frequent travelers, potentially leading to longer wait times for appointments. Nationals from specific countries face immediate interview requirements, and stricter rescheduling policies will be enforced.
title: US ends visa interview waivers from Sept 2; Is India spared from toughest restrictions?

author: IPSITA PATI
description: Gurgaon was hit by torrential rain on Monday, causing widespread flooding and traffic chaos. Several areas were submerged, with waterlogging reaching up to three feet in depth. Commuters faced severe delays, and the IMD has issued alerts for more heavy showers.
title: Gurgaon flooded: NH-48 traffic crawls for hours; more showers likely in next 2 days

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Delhi-NCR experienced heavy rainfall and gusty winds on Monday, providing respite from the heat but causing significant disruptions. Waterlogging and traffic jams plagued the region, with rising Yamuna levels prompting flood alerts and the closure of the Old Railway Bridge. Commuters faced severe congestion, and travel advisories were issued by airlines.
title: Leaking flyover & flooded streets: Rain cripples Delhi-NCR; 10 videos reveal havoc

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: US Open hat snatch: Polish CEO finally confesses - here’s why it’s not working

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Queen Camilla's past bravery resurfaces in Valentine Low's new book, revealing how she defended herself against a sexual assault on a train as a teenager. She struck her attacker with her shoe, leading to his arrest.
title: What happened when Queen Camilla faced a creep; new book reveals

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Former vice-president Jagdeep Dhankhar has vacated his official residence following his resignation and temporarily relocated to a farmhouse in Chhatarpur owned by INLD leader Abhay Chautala. This arrangement will continue until he receives a Type-VIII government residence, which he is eligible for as a former vice-president.
title: Ex-VP Dhankhar moves to private farmhouse – what about his official house?

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
title: Trump targets India again, calls trade 'one-sided disaster'; makes big tariff claim

author: CHIDANAND RAJGHATTA
description: White House trade counselor Peter Navarro ignited controversy by accusing "Brahmins" of profiting from refined Russian oil sales to the West, escalating US-India trade tensions. His remarks, following accusations of India being a "laundromat for Kremlin," sparked outrage and were deemed inflammatory.
title: 'Brahmins profiteering': Trump adviser's remark on Russian oil trade sparks outrage

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Gold prices soared to a record high of Rs 1,05,670 per 10 grams in the national capital, marking the sixth consecutive session of gains. The surge was fueled by expectations of a US Federal Reserve rate cut and strong overseas demand. Silver prices also reached a new peak of Rs 1,26,000 per kilogram, driven by industrial demand and speculative interest.
title: Gold prices hit all-time high of Rs 1.05 lakh per 10g

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: ‘I’m fine,’ says Trump — but far-right influencer cries ‘Biden 2.0 cover-up’

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The US Embassy in India affirmed the strong US-India ties, highlighting it as a defining relationship of the 21st century. Despite this positive outlook, trade tensions persist due to recent tariffs imposed by the US, citing trade deficits and India's Russian oil purchases.
title: Trump rattled? US tries to cosy up to India as PM Modi meets Putin, Xi

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Union minister Nitin Gadkari stated that honesty is challenging in politics, where deception can lead to leadership. Speaking at an event, he emphasized the importance of truth, non-violence, peace, humanity, and equality, drawing inspiration from Chakradhar Swami's teachings. Gadkari also highlighted the significance of values like honesty and dedication in society.
title: Watch: What's key to success in politics? Gadkari's unique advise

author: TOI TRENDING DESK
description: A viral video from the US Open shows Piotr Szczerek, CEO of Drogbruk, snatching a signed cap intended for a child, sparking global outrage. Social media users identified Szczerek, leading to a barrage of negative reviews for his company. Tennis player Kamil Majchrzak gifted the young fan, Brok, another signed cap.
title: Who is CEO Piotr Szczerek? Man who went viral for snatching a signed cap from kid

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The Supreme Court has dismissed a PIL challenging the nationwide implementation of 20% ethanol-blended petrol (E20). The petition requested that ethanol-free petrol be made available and that ethanol content be clearly labelled at fuel stations. The plea argued that older vehicles and some BS-VI models are not compatible with high ethanol blends, potentially causing damage and higher repair costs.
title: 20% ethanol blended petrol: SC dismisses PIL against nationwide rollout

author: etimes.in
description: Television industry mourns the death of Priya Marathe. She died at 38 after fighting cancer. Ankita Lokhande, her Pavitra Rishta co-star, shared her grief. She posted old photos and remembered their bond. Usha Nadkarni also expressed sadness. She recalled Priya's quiet nature and dedication to work. The industry remembers a talented actress gone too soon.
title: Ankita Lokhande mourns Pavitra Rishta co-star Priya Marathe’s demise

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The Army dismantled a Trinamool Congress stage in Kolkata's Maidan, citing a violation of permit regulations regarding the duration of events in the area. Mamata Banerjee criticized the BJP, accusing them of using the Army, while urging the forces to remain neutral. TMC alleges political targeting and plans to relocate the protest.
title: Army dismantles TMC stage: Mamata urges force to not 'play into BJP's hands'

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: As the Asia Cup 2025 approaches, debate intensifies over India's wicketkeeper. Aakash Chopra favors Sanju Samson, citing his impressive top-order T20 record with over 6,000 runs at a 140 strike rate. Samson's recent explosive form, including centuries against Bangladesh and South Africa, strengthens his case.
title: Asia Cup | Samson vs Jitesh debate ends! Ex-India cricketer gives verdict

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Actress Avneet Kaur addressed trolling in light of the Virat Kohli controversy, emphasizing the importance of family support in navigating online negativity. She acknowledged feeling low at times but highlighted her family's role in reminding her of her dreams and hard work. Kaur urged people to spread positivity and neutrality, advocating against putting others down while expressing opinions.
title: Avneet Kaur reacts to trolling after Virat Kohli 'like controversy'

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: Bihar SIR: SC says confusion over exercise 'largely trust issue'

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: 'Blatant interference by Russia': EU chief's plane hit by GPS jamming

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: A landslide on the Kedarnath national highway near Munkatiya claimed the lives of two individuals and injured six others on Monday. The deceased, identified as Rita and Chandra Singh from Uttarkashi, were struck by falling debris. The injured, also from Uttarkashi, are receiving medical treatment.
title: Boulders fall on tourist vehicle on Kedarnath route after landslide; 2 dead

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Cambricon Technologies, a Chinese AI chip designer, has seen its stock price surge, positioning it as a strong domestic competitor to Nvidia. This growth is fueled by its software compatibility, making it easier to deploy AI models. With backing from Beijing and strategic partnerships, Cambricon aims to capture a significant share of China's AI chip market, reducing reliance on US.
title: China's answer to Nvidia: How 2 brothers built Beijing's AI weapon; stocks up 1000%

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: FIDE CEO Emil Sutovsky refuted Hikaru Nakamura's claims that the Candidates' rating qualification spot was designed for Magnus Carlsen's potential return. Sutovsky clarified that the rule has existed for years and now benefits top players like Nakamura. He emphasised the spot ensures the inclusion of the world's best, not specifically targeting Carlsen, whose return is deemed unlikely.
title: FIDE CEO slams Hikaru's claims of Carlsen Candidates favouritism

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Florida's controversial immigration detention facility, "Alligator Alcatraz," is set to close following a federal judge's order, highlighting tensions between state and federal authorities. The facility, built rapidly in the Everglades, faced criticism over its remote location, alleged unsanitary conditions, and restricted access for families and lawyers.
title: Florida’s 'Alligator Alcatraz' to close: Detention centre empties; judge orders shutdown

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Goods and Services Tax (GST) collections demonstrated a 6.5% year-over-year increase in August, reaching Rs 1.86 lakh crore, as per official government data. The preceding month saw even higher gross GST collections, totaling Rs 1.96 lakh crore.
title: GST collections hit Rs 1.86L cr; 6.5% increase YoY

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge accused Prime Minister Narendra Modi of attempting to steal votes in the upcoming Bihar assembly elections. He asserted that the NDA's double-engine government would soon be ousted, replaced by a government representing the poor, backward communities, and Dalits. Kharge also criticized Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's alliance with the BJP-RSS, questioning his socialist principles.
title: 'Habit of chori': Kharge targets PM Modi - predicts end of NDA rule soon

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Rahul Gandhi, leader of opposition, has accused the BJP of "vote chori" and promised a new exposé, a "hydrogen bomb," following claims of similar electoral malpractices in Mahadevpura. He asserted that PM Modi would be unable to face the public after this revelation.
title: 'Hydrogen bomb soon': Rahul hints new expose on 'vote chori'; BJP reacts

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Lalit Modi stirred controversy by sharing an old video of the infamous IPL 'slapgate' incident between Harbhajan Singh and S. Sreesanth. Harbhajan expressed his disappointment, suggesting a selfish motive behind resurfacing the 18-year-old incident. He acknowledged his mistake, reiterated his regret, and mentioned seeking forgiveness.
title: 'I feel ashamed': Harbhajan on slapping Sreesanth; calls Lalit Modi 'selfish'

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: The ICC has announced a massive 297% increase in prize money for the 2025 Women's Cricket World Cup, totaling $13.88 million. This surpasses the 2023 Men's World Cup payout, signaling a major step towards gender pay parity. Winners will receive $4.48 million, a 239% jump from 2022.
title: ICC unveils Women’s WC 2025 prize money; surpasses men’s edition

author: TOI SCIENCE DESK
description: NASA astronaut Megan McArthur retires after two decades of remarkable contributions, including piloting the SpaceX Dragon and crucial work on the Hubble Space Telescope. McArthur's career highlights her technical expertise and leadership, notably as the final astronaut to operate Hubble with the space shuttle's robotic arm.
title: Megan McArthur retires from Nasa: First woman to pilot SpaceX Dragon retires

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Rinku Singh's five consecutive sixes in IPL 2023 against Gujarat Titans catapulted him to fame, significantly raising expectations and earning him immense love. He acknowledges the match gave him a unique identity, not just personally but for India. His consistent performance has secured him a place in India's Asia Cup 2025 squad, where they will face UAE, Pakistan and Oman.
title: Night to remember! Rinku finally talks about that unforgettable 5-six finish

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Russian President Vladimir Putin engaged in an extended private discussion on Monday, taking place within Putin's Aurus limousine following the SCO summit. According to PTI reports, Putin offered Modi a ride, using the opportunity to continue their one-on-one talks for nearly an hour before their scheduled formal bilateral meeting.
title: 'Not for the ears of others': When Putin offered a lift to 'dear friend' PM Modi

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: A video of Polish businessman Piotr Szczerek grabbing a signed cap intended for a young fan at the US Open sparked widespread outrage. The incident led to a review-bombing campaign against Szczerek's company, Drogbruk, severely damaging its online reputation.
title: Polish CEO row: US Open incident sparks outrage; company Drogbruk faces review-bombing

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff announced a significant reduction of 4,000 customer support positions, a 45% decrease, as AI agents now handle 50% of customer interactions. This shift contrasts with Benioff's July statements, where he downplayed AI's potential for mass unemployment. The company is also utilizing AI to address a backlog of over 100 million uncalled sales leads.
title: Salesforce cuts 4,000 jobs: AI replace half of support staff; CEO flip-flops

author: SUMIT ROY
description: Donald Trump wants Roger Clemens in the Baseball Hall of Fame. He urged Clemens to sue Major League Baseball. Trump highlighted Clemens' achievements and denied drug use allegations. He compared Clemens' situation to Pete Rose's case. Trump criticized MLB for delaying Rose's consideration. He emphasized talent should be the reason for Hall of Fame induction.
title: Trump blasts MLB chiefs in push for Roger Clemens Hall of Fame spot

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Dinesh Karthik praises Jitesh Sharma's mindset regarding national team selection. Karthik helped Jitesh refine his finishing skills while at Royal Challengers Bengaluru. Jitesh's IPL 2025 performance earned him a spot back on the Indian squad. He aims to solidify his position in the upcoming Asia Cup 2025. Sanju Samson is currently the preferred wicketkeeper.
title: 'Was never desperate to play for India before': Karthik lauds youngster

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: A devastating 6.0-magnitude earthquake struck Afghanistan's Kunar province, resulting in at least 250 fatalities and over 500 injuries. The midnight quake, followed by aftershocks, toppled homes along the Pakistan border. Rescue operations are underway in remote districts, with the toll expected to rise due to difficult access and fragile housing in the region.
title: Afghanistan earthquake: Over 800 killed, thousands injured

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: In Bengaluru, a 35-year-old woman, Vanajakshi, tragically died after her live-in partner, Vithal, allegedly set her on fire following a history of domestic disputes. Vithal, a cab driver, was arrested after he intercepted a car Vanajakshi was traveling in, pouring petrol on her and the other occupants at a traffic signal.
title: Bengaluru man chases live-in partner’s car, douses her in petrol; sets her ablaze

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: India is increasingly favoring gold over US Treasury bills to bolster its foreign exchange reserves, mirroring a global trend of diversifying away from dollar-denominated assets. While India's US T-bill holdings decreased to $227 billion in June 2025, its gold reserves rose significantly to 879.98 metric tonnes.
title: India reduces US Treasury bill holdings! Gold up in forex reserves; check details

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Farokh Engineer, the match referee during the infamous 'Slapgate' incident in the 2008 IPL, expressed surprise at the recent release of the footage. He emphasized maintaining confidentiality and believes the matter should remain in the past, as both Harbhajan Singh and S. Sreesanth have likely moved on. The resurfacing of the clip has stirred reactions, with Sreesanth's wife expressing disappointment and anger.
title: IPL Slapgate: Match referee breaks silence; calls Harbhajan a good friend

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: A devastating magnitude 6 earthquake struck eastern Afghanistan near the Pakistan border on Sunday, resulting in a tragic loss of over 800 lives and leaving approximately 1300 individuals injured. The powerful tremors caused widespread destruction, leveling numerous villages and buildings in the affected region. Rescue operations are currently underway, with medical teams dispatched from neighboring provinces and Kabul to provide assistance.
title: Over 800 dead, thousands injured in Afghanistan quake; villages flattened

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) strongly condemned the terrorist attack in Pahalgam on April 22, 2025, expressing condolences to the victims' families. The SCO reaffirmed its commitment to fighting terrorism, separatism, and extremism, emphasizing that perpetrators must face justice. Following the attack that killed 26, India launched Operation Sindoor, targeting terror hideouts across the border.
title: SCO member states condemn Pahalgam attack in Tianjin declaration; express condolences

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Silver price today: Silver prices experienced a significant surge, climbing by Rs 2,597 to exceed Rs 1.24 lakh per kilogram in futures trading, mirroring strong global market performance. This surge was fueled by factors such as increased US tariffs on Indian products, a weakening rupee, and investors seeking safe-haven assets.
title: Silver price today: Silver hits record high; crosses Rs 1.24 lakh mark

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: In Thane's Titwala area, a 23-year-old woman tragically died by suicide during a video call with her boyfriend. Police have detained him following accusations from her family of harassment, blackmail, and cheating other women. Allegedly, he took her jewellery and threatened to release private videos when she asked for its return, leading to her desperate act.
title: Maharashtra: Woman ends life during video call with boyfriend

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Farhan Akhtar has clarified that 'Jee Le Zaraa,' initially planned with Priyanka Chopra, Alia Bhatt, and Katrina Kaif, is not shelved but is currently on hold. While he's unsure about the original cast's involvement and timing, Akhtar confirms the script and pre-production work are complete. Alia Bhatt also expressed optimism, citing scheduling conflicts as the primary challenge.
title: 'Jee Le Zarra': Farhan Akhtar confirms film still on cards

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: A devastating 6.0-magnitude earthquake struck Afghanistan's Kunar province, resulting in at least 250 fatalities and over 500 injuries. The midnight quake, followed by aftershocks, toppled homes along the Pakistan border. Rescue operations are underway in remote districts, with the toll expected to rise due to difficult access and fragile housing in the region.
title: Afghanistan earthquake: Over 600 killed, thousands injured

author: SANJAY SHARMA
description: The National Statistics Office (NSO) has released findings from the Comprehensive Modular Survey: Education (CMS:E) 2025, highlighting gender-wise differences in education expenditure across India. The survey shows that boys' education expenses are consistently higher than girls' in both rural and urban areas, covering government and private schools. Spending on tuition fees, uniforms, transport, textbooks, and private coaching was examined, with urban averages significantly higher. The report provides detailed comparisons by level of enrolment and type of school.
title: Boys vs girls: NSS 2025 survey compares education spend

author: TNN
description: In a shocking verdict, a Udaipur court sentenced Kishandas to death for the gruesome murder of his wife, Laxmi, in 2017. Kishandas, driven by disdain for Laxmi's appearance, tricked her into applying a flammable chemical before setting her ablaze. The court deemed the crime exceptionally heinous, warranting capital punishment to deter similar acts.
title: ‘Dark and fat’ taunts: Rajasthan man gets death for burning wife alive

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Gold price prediction today: Gold and silver prices are surging to new heights, fueled by expectations of a US Federal Reserve rate cut, geopolitical tensions, and a weaker rupee. Market volatility is anticipated this week due to a US holiday and upcoming economic data releases, including US jobs market figures and PMI numbers from major economies.
title: Gold price prediction: What's the outlook this week - should you buy or sell?

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: Himachal Pradesh has been devastated by relentless monsoon rains since June 20, resulting in over 300 deaths and widespread destruction. Landslides, flash floods, and road blockages have crippled the state, severely impacting agriculture and pilgrimage routes. Authorities are focused on relief efforts as more heavy rainfall is expected, with schools closed and warnings issued.
title: Over 300 dead in Himachal as heavy rains trigger landslides, floods

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: Pakistan: Helicopter crashes in Diamer, at least five killed

author: ABHINAV GARG
description: The Delhi High Court reprimanded an accused, imposing a ₹10,000 penalty for suggesting that dropping a rape case would protect the minor survivor from stigma.
title: 'Stigma of rape on perpetrator, not survivor': Delhi HC chides rape accused

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Aaradhya Bachchan recently visited a Ganeshotsav pandal, captivating onlookers. Aaradhya's appearance, sporting an orange ensemble and wavy hair, sparked comparisons to a rare, unseen teenage photo of Aishwarya. The uncanny resemblance between mother and daughter, from facial features to their smiles, has ignited online buzz, with many noting Aaradhya is her mother's mirror image.
title: Aaradhya Bachchan's resemblance to her mother in unseen teenage photos will leave you amazed

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: A devastating 6.0-magnitude earthquake struck Afghanistan's Kunar province, resulting in at least 250 fatalities and over 500 injuries. The midnight quake, followed by aftershocks, toppled homes along the Pakistan border. Rescue operations are underway in remote districts, with the toll expected to rise due to difficult access and fragile housing in the region.
title: Afghanistan earthquake: Over 600 killed, thousands injured

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: India's manufacturing sector experienced substantial growth in August, with the PMI reaching a 17.5-year high of 59.3. This surge was fueled by heightened production volumes, driven by improved supply-demand coordination and robust domestic demand.
title: India’s mfg PMI hits 17.5-year high; output rate expansion fastest in nearly 5 yrs

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: 'Insightful conversations': PM Modi, Putin travel in same car to the venue; bilateral talks next

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Despite their strong bond and memorable IPL partnerships for RCB, AB de Villiers didn't include Virat Kohli in his top five Test cricketers. De Villiers named Jacques Kallis, Andrew Flintoff, Mohammad Asif, Shane Warne, and Sachin Tendulkar. He praised Kallis as potentially the best cricketer ever and Asif as the best seamer he faced.
title: Sorry Virat! De Villiers picks Sachin in his top 5; includes tainted Pakistan bowler

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Labor Day, celebrated on the first Monday of September, honors American workers and their contributions to the US economy. Many banks, government offices, and the stock market will be closed. While some retail stores like Costco will be closed, others such as Walmart and Trader Joe's will remain open, with pharmacy hours varying by location.
title: US Labor Day: Are banks, stock markets and stores open or closed on September 1? Check full list

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Piotr Szczerek, a millionaire businessman, faces backlash after taking a signed cap from a child at the US Open. The incident sparked outrage. Szczerek defended his actions, further fueling criticism. Online users called for boycotts of his company, Drogbruk. Tennis player Kamil Majchrzak gifted the boy a new cap. The millionaire has warned legal action against those abusing him online.
title: US Open: Polish millionaire defends cap-snatch moment with young fan; warns legal action

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: A devastating 6.0-magnitude earthquake struck Afghanistan's Kunar province, resulting in at least 250 fatalities and over 500 injuries. The midnight quake, followed by aftershocks, toppled homes along the Pakistan border. Rescue operations are underway in remote districts, with the toll expected to rise due to difficult access and fragile housing in the region.
title: Afghanistan earthquake: Over 500 killed, thousands injured

author: TNN
description: Tensions over darshan and prasad distribution at Delhi's Kalkaji Temple appear to be the motive behind the murder of Yogendra Singh. Previous confrontations between the victim and the accused escalated into a fatal attack. Police have arrested five individuals, including the father of one attacker who allegedly provided shelter, and are searching for two more suspects.
title: Kalkaji Temple sewadar beaten to death: Attackers and victim had history of run-ins

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Addressing the SCO Summit in Tianjin, PM Modi urged a united global front against terrorism, emphasizing that no double standards are acceptable. He highlighted India's experience with terrorism and the need for consistent opposition to it.
title: 'No double standards on terror': PM Modi's stern message to Pak at SCO; Shehbaz Sharif present

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: At the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit in Tianjin, Chinese President Xi Jinping criticized what he termed the "bullying behaviour" in the world order. He urged Russia and India to resist a "Cold War mentality." Prime Minister Narendra Modi also participated in the summit, which focused on charting the SCO's future.
title: SCO Summit: Xi slams 'bullying behaviour'; urges to oppose 'Cold War mentality'

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Donald Trump warned that the US would become a "Third World Nation" if courts struck down his tariffs. He defended them, claiming over $15 trillion would be invested in the US due to these tariffs, calling it a record. Trump emphasized that tariffs are strengthening the economy, leading to lower prices and virtually no inflation.
title: 'Third World Nation' fear: Trump warns of fallout if tariffs struck down

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: During the SCO Summit in Tianjin, PM Modi and President Putin displayed camaraderie, while PM Modi and President Xi discussed border peace and resuming flights. India's S-400 missile defense system, dubbed "Sudarshan Chakra," played a crucial role in Operation Sindoor, successfully intercepting Pakistani drones and missiles aimed at Indian cities, bolstering India's air defense capabilities.
title: Watch: PM Modi, Putin walk past Pak PM at SCO Summit; Shehbaz Sharif left looking on

author: SUDEEP LAVANIA
description: Agra's famed petha industry faces an uncertain future as a Supreme Court directive orders relocation of manufacturing units within the Taj Trapezium Zone to protect the Taj Mahal from pollution. This move threatens the livelihoods of nearly 5,000 people involved in the trade, who fear the financial burden of restarting elsewhere.
title: Why is Agra’s Rs 500 crore petha industry facing existential crisis?

author: TNN
description: In Bengaluru's BTM Layout, a 21-year-old woman was sexually harassed and robbed in her PG accommodation. An intruder entered her room early in the morning, assaulted her, and stole Rs 2,500. Despite her efforts to stop him, he escaped, and police are investigating the incident, which occurred at Laxmana Durga Ladies PG. The security guard was asleep during the incident.
title: Bengaluru sexual assault: Knife-wielding intruder harasses PG girl, escapes with cash

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Prime Minister Modi, Russian President Putin, and Chinese President Xi Jinping displayed camaraderie at the SCO Summit 2025 in Tianjin, exchanging handshakes and hugs. Modi shared pictures of the interactions on X, emphasizing the importance of exchanging perspectives. Xi Jinping, in his banquet address, called for unity among SCO members to safeguard regional peace amid global uncertainties.
title: Camaraderie at SCO: PM Modi, Putin, Xi share warm moments

author: RICHA PINTO
description: Protests in Mumbai's CSMT area severely impacted weekend sales around Crawford Market as festival shoppers stayed away due to safety concerns. The large crowds, numbering around 30,000, overwhelmed the BMC, leading to sanitation issues and strained resources.
title: Mumbai gridlock: Protesters camp, cook, urinate on streets; BMC scales up services

author: etimes.in
description: Actress Priya Marathe, known for her roles in Pavitra Rishta and Kasamh Se, sadly passed away at 38 after battling cancer. Her last social media post, featuring her husband Shantanu Moghe at Amer Fort, has become a poignant memory for fans.
title: Priya Marathe’s sudden demise at 38: Who is her husband Shantanu Moghe?

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Monday. While Nifty50 was above 24,500, BSE Sensex was up over 300 points.
title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens above 24,500; Sensex up over 300 points

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Peter Navarro accused India of indirectly funding Russia's war in Ukraine through discounted oil purchases, alleging that Brahmins are profiting at the expense of the Indian people. He criticized India's high tariffs, claiming they hurt American workers and taxpayers while indirectly funding the Russian war machine. Navarro also expressed optimism about trade negotiations with China.
title: 'Brahmins profiteering': Trump aide's latest jibe at India over Russian oil

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Wasim Akram hailed Jasprit Bumrah as a “modern-day great,” praising India for expertly managing his workload. While refusing to compare eras, Akram highlighted the increased challenges bowlers face in modern cricket due to aggressive batting. He also opposed the two-tier WTC system, stressing the need for quality teams and stronger domestic structures before introducing more nations to Test cricket.
title: 'Bumrah is world class, credit to India for managing his workload': Wasim Akram

author: TNN
title: Buy or sell: Stock recommendation by brokers for September 1

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Elon Musk has ignited debate by agreeing with a Pakistani man's claim about demographic shifts in Denmark, highlighting his ongoing concern about global population decline. Musk argues that declining birth rates pose a significant threat to civilization, potentially leading to economic stagnation and labor shortages. He has also warned about Japan's population decline, suggesting AI as a potential solution.
title: Population collapse warning: Pakistani man warns Danish man; Elon Musk responds

author: JYOTIRMOY HALDER
description: Aarini Lahoty, a five-year-old chess prodigy from Delhi, has made history as the youngest Indian player to achieve FIDE ratings in classical, rapid, and blitz formats. Born in 2019, she is the first from her age group to accomplish this feat, holding impressive ratings across all three categories.
title: History! Meet 5-year-old Aarini Lahoty - India’s youngest with FIDE ratings

author: ASMITA DEY
description: E-commerce sellers on platforms like Amazon and Flipkart are facing uncertainty regarding GST slab changes ahead of the festive season sales. Concerns include delays in reflecting updated tax rates on platforms, discrepancies in invoicing, and issues with product returns due to rate differences.
title: GST rejig: E-comm sellers brace for billing woes amid festive rush

author: SIDHARTHA
description: Team GST is convening to address the tax slabs on various services, including hotel rooms, air travel, and banking, with potential rate adjustments under consideration. While some services like casino entry fees may face higher taxes, there's a push to ease rates on common services like apartment maintenance charges.
title: Hotel rooms-casinos: Services facing 12%, 28% GST in focus

author: H M CHAITHANYA SWAMY
description: A Bengaluru software engineer lost Rs 91 lakh in a cyber fraud that spanned five weeks. Lured by a Telegram user with a work-from-home offer promising high returns, the engineer was directed to a fake hotel booking website. He made multiple deposits before realizing he had been scammed and reported the incident to the police.
title: Lure of easy money: Techie in Bengaluru duped of Rs 91 lakh in work-from-home scam

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: A 39-year-old man was arrested in Sydney after intentionally crashing his car into the Russian consulate on Monday morning. The incident occurred around 8 am, prompting a police response to reports of an unauthorized vehicle. During the arrest, a 24-year-old police officer sustained a hand injury and received on-site treatment.
title: Man arrested after car crashes into Russian Consulate in Australia - watch

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Janhvi Kapoor and Sidharth Malhotra's 'Param Sundari' has seen a successful opening weekend, earning ₹26.75 crore in its first three days. The rom-com, directed by Tushar Jalota, witnessed a steady increase in box office collections, with Sunday recording the highest single-day earnings. Critics have praised the film's picturesque backdrops, music, and the charming chemistry between the lead actors.
title: ‘Param Sundari’ picks pace: Rs 10.25cr Sunday lifts total; rom-com crosses Rs 26cr in 3 days

author: AMIT KUMAR
description: Rinku Singh, known for his T20 heroics, asserts his capabilities extend to red-ball cricket, aiming to represent India in Tests. Preparing for the Asia Cup 2025, he emphasizes evolving his technique with guidance from Abhishek Nair and Gautam Gambhir. Singh aspires to contribute across all formats, driven by self-belief and a desire to win the T20 World Cup.
title: Rinku Singh Exclusive: 'Don't like being tagged as T20I specialist'

author: ADVITYA BAHL
description: During a birthday celebration in Sector 134's JP Cosmos Society, Vikram Thakur, a 25-year-old unemployed car driver, allegedly shot himself in the head. The incident occurred around 2:15 am, leaving Vikram in critical condition at a private hospital.
title: Noida: Man shoots self during birthday party after breakup with girlfriend; critical

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: The 2025 college football season kicked off with upsets and power shifts, highlighted by Ohio State's victory over Texas. Florida State's dominant performance against Alabama also shook up the rankings. These results are expected to significantly alter the Week 2 AP Top 25 poll, with teams like Illinois potentially rising and Alabama facing a steep drop.
title: College football: AP Poll Week 2 predictions - Who rises, who falls in the rankings

author: TNN
description: In Bengaluru, a 41-year-old man, Manju Prakash, tragically died after a snake bit him in his shoe. The incident occurred at his residence in Ranganatha Layout, Bannerghatta. Manju, unaware of the snake, wore the shoe and went to bed, and was later found unresponsive.
title: Bengaluru shocker: Employee slips on shoe; hidden viper bites leading to death

author: TNN
description: A powerful explosion at an illegal firecracker factory in Lucknow's Behta village resulted in the tragic deaths of a couple and injuries to at least five others. The blast, which occurred on Sunday afternoon, caused the collapse of several houses and triggered a massive rescue operation. Forensic teams confirmed the presence of firecracker-making materials at the site, indicating unlicensed manufacturing.
title: Couple killed, 2 critical among injured in firecracker factory blast in Lucknow

author: ROHIT MULLICK AND SANJAY KHAJURIA
description: Torrential monsoon rains have triggered flash floods and landslides in Himachal Pradesh and Jammu & Kashmir, severely disrupting transportation and trade. Key highways, including national routes, are blocked, leaving farmers in Lahaul-Spiti facing significant losses due to disrupted apple markets.
title: ‘Highways buried’: Landslides, floods batter Himachal & J&K; pilgrimages halted

author: SACHIN PARASHAR
description: Amid strained India-US relations and global trade concerns, PM Modi and President Xi Jinping met to strengthen cooperation on trade, terrorism, and regional issues, emphasizing their roles as development partners, not rivals. They reaffirmed strategic autonomy, aiming to resolve border disputes peacefully and boost economic ties while maintaining border tranquility.
title: Modi, Xi agree India China partners, not rivals, can help stabilise world trade

author: TNN
description: Krishnanagar Police apprehended Kuldeep Singh, uncle of Deshraj Singh, from Gujarat's Jamnagar for allegedly tampering with evidence in the Ishita Mallik murder case. Kuldeep is accused of helping Deshraj, who fatally shot Mallik, flee after the incident. Police suspect Kuldeep knows Deshraj's whereabouts and that the firearm was sourced from Uttar Pradesh.
title: Ishita Mallik murder: How killer fled West Bengal with uncle’s help
